intro: Psydrax manambyanus, commonly known as the Manambyan tree, is a tropical evergreen species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers that are often visited by various pollinators, including bees and birds. Its fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that contains several seeds. Due to its unique morphology and restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
